TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 1234
TEI.2.document_title: Robert Williams to Stephen F. Ausin, 11-18-1825

barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 1234

text.body:
*div1 type="summary"* *p*Concerning slaves.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**date_mentioned n="11-18-1825">18 Nov. 1825*/date_mentioned**/p* *p**person_mentioned*Col. Austin*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*I was one day late Starting of the *person_mentioned*Boy*/person_mentioned* that I anticipated owing to my Losing of a horse*location_mentioned* on the rode */location_mentioned**person_mentioned*your man Mose*/person_mentioned* come back with *person_mentioned*Augustus*/person_mentioned* for *person_mentioned*Eliza Brooks*/person_mentioned* to ride home as my horse died *location_mentioned*on the road*/location_mentioned* it will be out of my power to procure her a horse as there is none *location_mentioned*in the settlement */location_mentioned*and at the time she returns home my horse will be *location_mentioned*on the camppain*/location_mentioned* the Bond that I gave you for the delivery of the *person_mentioned*Boy*/person_mentioned* you will deliver *person_mentioned*Mr Vandorne*/person_mentioned* in comply[ing] you will oblige me—*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Robt Williams*/person_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
